title: Lag spikes in lol
body:
Getting random spikes in games, Normally on 51-52ms spikes can get up to 600ms briefly 

here is my tracert:

Tracing route to 103.240.227.5 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  NB604N.home [192.168.1.1] 
  2     *        *        *     Request timed out.
  3    23 ms    22 ms    23 ms  ae-5-10.cpcak3-r2.tranzpeer.net [101.98.3.41] 
  4    22 ms    23 ms    21 ms  ae-4-10.cpcak3-r2.tranzpeer.net [101.98.3.40] 
  5    22 ms    22 ms    23 ms  as9790.akl-ix.nz [43.243.21.3] 
  6    23 ms    22 ms    22 ms  as4826.akl-ix.nz [43.243.21.27] 
  7    46 ms    46 ms    46 ms  ten-0-1-0-2.cor01.alb01.akl.VOCUS.net.nz [114.31.202.38] 
  8    47 ms    45 ms    45 ms  114.31.202.83 
  9    46 ms    46 ms    45 ms  ten-1-0-0.bdr03.syd04.nsw.VOCUS.net.au [175.45.72.73] 
 10    48 ms    50 ms    57 ms  as6507.cust.bdr03.syd04.nsw.VOCUS.net.au [175.45.107.94] 
 11     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 12     *        *        *     Request timed out.

 15     *        *        *     Request timed out.

 23     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 24     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 25     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 26     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 27     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 28     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 29     *        *        *     Request timed out.
 30     *        *        *     Request timed out.

Trace complete.

replies.body: First time this has been happening to you? or has been happening for the past few days?

This happened a few patches back, but only starting appearing again for the current patch.

But maybe for a week now?

Try this old fix: 1) Go to desktop
2) Hold down the windows button, and press X
3) Select device manager
4) Click networks, and drop it down
(You will see the program I stated above called Microsoft Windows Kernel Debug Network Adapter)
5) Right click it and select disable or uninstall. I uninstalled it.
6) Restart computer and play LoL.
thanks Ill give it a go now
no change unfortunately and yes I have reset my internet a few times
have you tryed to repair your client?
also im assuming that you have tried to restart your internet
also mabye trying to reinstall your patch might work sometimes its something wrong with the patch you downloaded might be corrputed

Nothing immediately stands out to me, looking at your tracert. Can you try the solutions in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article and see if anything resolves your issue?
